keywords.indexterm: Configure the interface (Change interface colors) (Change color theme) Accessibility

body.p: This preferences page contains a number of options that allow you to change the appearance of the user interface of . To configure the Appearance options, and click on Appearance .

The following options are available in the Appearance preferences page:
Look and Feel - This option allows you to change the graphic style (look and feel) of the user interface. Depending on the operating system, you can choose between different predefined style options.
Theme - This option allows you to set a color theme that will be applied over the entire user interface. You can choose between predefined color themes, and you can also change various options within the selected theme. Links to pages for the various options are displayed in the Appearance preferences page. The result of the applied modifications is displayed in the XML Preview area.In Windows, if the Look and Feel and Theme options are set to their default values, inherits the high contrast theme colors that are set in the operating system.In MAC OS X (starting with Yosemite), if you choose Graphite for the Theme, it is recommended that you enable the Use dark menu and Dock option that is found in System Preferences General .
